title: CRISPR Element Detector
description: This feature specifically detects CRISPR elements (repeats, spacers, and arrays) and associated regulatory regions. The feature shows strong, concentrated spike activations directly at or immediately adjacent to CRISPR-related sequences. Functionally, this likely represents detection of the characteristic repeat-spacer architecture or specific sequence motifs common in CRISPR systems, which play crucial roles in bacterial adaptive immunity against phage infection. The pattern is highly consistent across examples from diverse bacterial phyla (including Firmicutes and Spirochetes), suggesting this feature captures fundamental and evolutionarily conserved aspects of CRISPR system architecture rather than organism-specific variations.
